title: How to Lengthen the Life of Batteries Without Recharging

steps.headline: If your device is a camera, turn it off immediately after usage.
steps.description: If it's a phone or laptop, put the device on sleep, hibernate, or some other battery-preserving mode.

steps.headline: Set the functionality settings to the lowest reasonably possible level.
steps.description: For example, dim the screen brightness, set the device to sleep after a certain amount of no usage, etc.

steps.headline: Do not run more apps than you need open.
steps.description: For instance, don't let the word processor that you're not using stay open. Close the program. If you think you'll need it soon, most programs start up pretty quickly.

steps.headline: Avoid graphic-intensive games.
steps.description: While you may love your car racing game, it probably isn't that good on your battery.

text: If your device is a camera, turn it off immediately after usage. If it's a phone or laptop, put the device on sleep, hibernate, or some other battery-preserving mode. Set the functionality settings to the lowest reasonably possible level. For example, dim the screen brightness, set the device to sleep after a certain amount of no usage, etc. Do not run more apps than you need open. For instance, don't let the word processor that you're not using stay open. Close the program. If you think you'll need it soon, most programs start up pretty quickly. Avoid graphic-intensive games. While you may love your car racing game, it probably isn't that good on your battery. Enjoy!
